snippet: State Senator Adriano Espaillat, running in the Democratic primary for Representative Charles B. Rangel’s seat, now has the support of a prominent Latino leader, Fernando Ferrer.
abstract: Fernando Ferrer, former Bronx borough president and prominent Hispanic leader, endorses State Senator Adriano Espaillat in his bid for Rep Charles B Rangel's Congressional seat. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: State Senator Adriano Espaillat, intensifying his outreach to Latino voters in his campaign to defeat Representative Charles B. Rangel, was endorsed on Monday by one of the city's most prominent Hispanic leaders, Fernando Ferrer. Mr. Espaillat is the most prominent of several Democratic challengers to Mr. Rangel, a veteran Harlem congressman whose bid for re-election has been complicated this year by redistricting, which transformed the area, long a center of black political power, into a district with a Hispanic majority. Mr. Espaillat is Dominican-American and would be the first Dominican-born person to serve in Congress; the district now includes part of the Bronx and is known as the 13th Congressional District.

headline.main: A Prominent Endorsement For a Challenger to Rangel
